diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@

+
+#include "tensorflow/core/framework/op.h"
+
+namespace tensorflow {
+
+REGISTER_OP("BatchNormalizeTraining")
+    .Input("input: T")
+    .Input("scale: T")
+    .Input("bias: T")
+    .Input("running_mean: Ref(T)")
+    .Input("running_inv_var: Ref(T)")
+    .Output("out: T")
+    .Output("save_mean: T")
+    .Output("save_inv_var: T")
+    .Attr("T: {float}")
+    .Attr("epsilon: float")
+    .Attr("exponential_average_factor: float")
+    .Doc(R"doc(
+Perform batch normalization using batch statistics.
body:
TensorFlow default data_format is NHWC. So we need to support that at least. 

There are two ways: 
1. Call the Cudnn version of NHWC. 
2. Sometimes #1 is too slow, it is okay to call NHWCToNCHW first, do the op in NCHW, and then transform back to NHWC.
body_html:
TensorFlow default data_format is NHWC. So we need to support that at least.

There are two ways:

  1. Call the Cudnn version of NHWC.
  2. Sometimes #1 is too slow, it is okay to call NHWCToNCHW first, do the op in NCHW, and then transform back to NHWC.
body_text:
TensorFlow default data_format is NHWC. So we need to support that at least.
There are two ways:

Call the Cudnn version of NHWC.
Sometimes #1 is too slow, it is okay to call NHWCToNCHW first, do the op in NCHW, and then transform back to NHWC.
